Entries.default: "Light of Eothas be upon you."
"Bearn said you could tell us about the Partisans of the Lighted Path."
"Your friend guided you truly. Gaderian Bosc has honored me with the duty of helping his message reach all of the faithful."
"We answer the Shining God's call. He shows us the way and we march in his wake."
"Already the vanguard prepares to make its journey, with more soon to follow."
"How would you join up with Eothas? Chase him in a boat?"
"Who are the vanguard?"
"How would I join the vanguard?"
"Yes, in fact. We will follow him along the lighted path."
"When the time is right, he will welcome our souls into his legion. Gaderian Bosc has seen it."
"Just your souls, then? Not uh, not your bodies?"
"Your journey sounds dangerous."
"The Shining God demands total commitment from his followers."
"What good is a soldier who is not willing to make the ultimate sacrifice for her cause?"
"To walk the lighted path, one must be willing to never turn back."
"Tough to walk very far without a soul. The Hollowborn, usually you'd have to stack 'em in a wheelbarrow and push 'em around."
"Gaderian Bosc leads the vanguard. They are the most righteous of the Partisans."

"They will be the first to join the ranks of Eothas, the first to charge at his call."

Edér leans in toward you.
"Bearn said something about the vanguard. You don't think he's that dumb, do you?"
Ogne's eyes shift momentarily to Edér, then back to you. She says nothing, merely reraising her smile.
"I'm afraid you cannot. The vanguard is reserved for the most faithful among us. You have not even joined the Partisans."
"I have followed the lighted path all the way from its origin in Dyrwood as a grand pilgrimage."
"That I have only just learned of the Partisans is circumstance, not a measure of faith."
"Eothas does not play favorites as Woedica does. He would welcome all who wished to join him."
"There must be something we can do to change your mind."
"Perhaps you do have the glow of someone prepared to lead the charge."
"How right you are. Forgive me, I did not mean to cast doubt on your character."
"I agree, and Gaderian Bosc has admitted to the vanguard all who asked to join."
"It is no longer in my power to help you into the vanguard. We would still welcome you as a Partisan..."
"Unfortunately, even if I were to initiate you right now into our order, it would be too late to join the vanguard."

"Their ship is docked right now in Neketaka, and set to depart at any moment."

Edér looks at you with wide eyes.

"You think he could be on it? If he left right after we did..."

"We gotta go!"
"They won't take you. But there will be more ships to follow."
"That's a real nice offer. We'll think about it and get back to you."
"Farewell."
Ogne nods, her expression no different than it was when you arrived.
"Hold a moment. You asked about joining the vanguard."
"Listen, we didn't come for that. There's somebody in the vanguard that doesn't belong there."
"He's young and he lost his mother. He's not thinking real well."
"We just wanna get him back home. Can you tell us where they'd be?"
"Your friend has embraced the call of his god. He is of rare faith to have requested entry into our vanguard."
"Perhaps he is not the one in need of saving."
"I may have misspoken before. There may yet be a way for you to join them."
"In good conscience, the Partisans cannot allow faithless outsiders to try and corrupt our members."
"Therefore, it is better we do not permit you to leave at all."
"Say a prayer to the Shining God and you may be a part of his vanguard yet."
"The Shining God welcomes you once again."
This woman's unceasing smile and direct, violating gaze give the strong impression of someone selling something.
"Stay and learn about the Partisans of the Lighted Path, and I'll see that there is room for you."
"I took the cloth to serve Eothas. My faith is my life."
"Your dedication is admirable, and you are surely welcome among us."
"Light of Eothas be upon you."
"Do you have a list of people in the vanguard? We want to see if our friend is among them."

"The vanguard know their own. And Gaderian Bosc knows them. Beyond that, we keep such information private."

Edér turns his head away to hide a look of exasperation. But then it shifts, his eyes suddenly hopeful. He looks back at Ogne.
"If they know their own, what do you think they'd say to a couple of new members? Can we be in the vanguard, too?"

Edér rakes a hand down over his face as though to forcibly keep it composed.

He looks at you.
"This is going nowhere. C'mon, let's get out of here, I'll- I'll think of something."
